description.narrative:
Sida genom Sveriges ambassad, Bamako, tecknade den 2 december 2011 ett ramavtal med firman “Fiduciaire Africaine d´Audit, de Conseil, d´Informatique et de Management” (FAACIM-SARL) för revisionstjänster inom utvecklingssamarbetet. Avtalet löpte ut den 3 december 2015 och det finns inga ytterligare möjligheter till förlängning. Sida rekommenderar att utlandsmyndigheter som har fullständig delegering av medel för utvecklingssamarbetet ska ha ett ramavtal för revisionstjänster till sitt förfogande. Baserat på ovanstående och med hänsyn till ambassadens behov på området föreligger det därför skäl att upphandla ett nytt ramavtal för revisionstjänster inom utvecklingssamarbetet.
Möjlighet att täcka behovet med interna resurser föreligger inte. Tillämpligt ramavtal inom området finns inte.
Ramavtalet har till syfte att 1) ge Sveriges ambassad, Bamako, möjlighet att upphandla olika typer av revisionstjänster 2) assistera ambassaden och samarbetspartners att bygga intern kapacitet vad gäller revision 3) att på en ad hoc bas assistera med frågor som uppkommer med kort varsel och som kan besvaras samma dag via mail eller telefon, d.v.s. en sorts lokal "help desk" vad gäller revisionsfrågor.
Ramavtal ämnas tecknas med högst 3 parter och under 120 timmars arbete avropas avtalsparten genom ranking och över 120 timmar genom förnyad konkurrensutsättning. Insatsen innehåller dels själva ramavtalet men också utnyttjandet av ramavtalet, d.v.s. varje avrop blir en utbetalning under denna insats. Detta för att hålla ihop revisionstjänsterna och ha kontroll över hur mycket som avropas och till vad mm. Ramavtalet ska vara giltigt två år med möjlighet att förlänga ytterligare två år, ett år i taget.

The Embassy of Sweden, Bamako, signed a Framework Agreement for Audit services on December 2011 with the firm “Fiduciaire Africaine d´Audit, de Conseil, d´Informatique et de Management” (FAACIM-SARL). The Framework Agreement, after an extension of two years, expired on December 3, 2015, and no further extension can be made. Sida recommends that Embassies, which have received a full delegation of development cooperation funds, should have a Framework Agreement for Auditing Services at their disposal. Thus it is proposed that the Embassy of Sweden, Bamako, shall procure such an agreement for 206-2018 in accordance with the annexes to this decision. There are no internal resources available for this assignment and there is no Framework Agreement available within the area of competence.
This contribution will put in place a framework for audit services through an open tender procurement process. The aim is: (1) to give the Embassy of Sweden, Bamako, the possibility to undertake different types of auditing and related services including financial assurance and nonassurance audits and other audit related services (2) to assist the Embassy and counterpart institutions, authorities and organizations in building internal capacity relating to audit activities. (3) to assist on and adhoc basis in less complicated audit advice that can be given by telephone or email within a day. The agreement will be ranked for assignment up to 120 hours and renewed competition will be undertaken for all assignments above 120 hours. The ambition is to sign agreement with max 3 firms. The Framework Agreement shall be valid for two years with an option too prolong for two additional years, one year at a time.

description.narrative: During the year of 2018 the Framework agreement had been used for three internal management and control reviews of three partners respectively. The Embassy had thus made call-offs for the highest ranked audit firm AE2C to perform internal control review fo the following interventions: 1. The French Internatonal organisation GERES as a part of the assessment for the contribution 11799 Sustainable energy access for all. 2. The Malian Forest Auhority, Direction National des Eaux et Forêts (DNEF), as a part of the assessment for the contribution 10739 GEDEFOR 3/Agriculture Value Chains. 3. The Malian Water Authority, Direction Nationale de l'hydralique (DNH), for agreement amendment for the contribution 51130084 Integrated Water Resources Management and possible new support for DNH. The purpose of the audits was to obtain information whether the organisations had the capacity to manage funds from Sida. The audit concluded reviews and assessment of financial systems, authorisation order, audit process, procurement regulations and other relevant internal regulations. The analysis led in all cases to an assessment of the systems of the organisations and recommendations and proposals for improvement through action plans. It is the Embassy´s view that the consultant AE2C handled these assignments professionally and efficiently and that the cooperation partner responded to and assisted the auditors in a responsible manner. The results of the audits during the year 2018 where that the Embassy by help of the reports and action plans could, based on risk and materiality, make better decisions on resource allocation for the contributions and also that the contributions set up for obtaining results and handling risks were far more adequate. During 2018, all three Framework agreements were prolonged for a year, until the end of September 2019. During 2019 the Framework agreements had not been utilised.
